definition: to leave office

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
office/duty
to relieve from office/to sack

sentences.english: I don't know if he's really leaving his job; it may only be hearsay.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他是否真的已经去职，那也许只是传闻。

sentences.english: I left the office on acount of the discontinuance of the business.
sentences.chinese: 由于所服务的公司解散，只好去职。

sentences.english: I left the position with the desire of improving my position.
sentences.chinese: 我为了找更高之职位，而请求去职。

sentences.english: my reason for leaving the company is that i wish to get into the advertising business.
sentences.chinese: 本人去职的缘故原由是希望在广告业方面有所成长。

definition: to resign from office/to dismiss from office
to ask sb to resign from a post
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
to take the blame/to accept responsibility (for a mistake)
to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to dismiss from office/to resign from office
to leave office
to transfer/to move to another post
to resume a post
to imprison
to hold an office or post
to admit responsibility and resign
to retire from a government post (old)
to resign a government post
to take over (as minister, manager etc)
